Text: Draft website PDF file Electricity Summit ConferenceElectricity Summit Organizing Committee Attached to this email message is the first draft of the conference website Please review it in the next two days and return suggestions to me It is a PDF file therefore if you do not have Adobe Acrobat Writer you will not be able to make adjustments on your screen I would suggest printing it out marking adjustmentsadditionssuggestions directly on the paper and faxing it back to me at Thank you Best regards Heather Electricity Summit Conferencepdf

Re Draft website Electricity Summit Conference Cc Bill I havent alerted the trade press yet but I think that it would be a good idea to do this tomorrow when the website is made public This way I can steer them in that direction for more details Best Heather At AM wrote Heather The site looks fine Have you started alerting the trade press That will be important for attendance and visibility Bill

Electricity Summit conference websiteColleagues Thank you for your input on the website I am incorporating your suggestions It will be posted with more color and polish by tomorrow morning After you review it again I will link it to the GSPP website and make it public I have just received final confirmation from Dean Laura Tyson as Moderator of the first panel session Have a good afternoonevening Best wishes Heather
Electricity Summit websiteColleagues The new draft website is at eventselectricitysummitconferencehtm Have a good weekend Talk to you on Monday Best wishes Heather

RE Electricity Summit websitehave been made Please view the website at eventselectricitysummitconferencehtm Please let me know your thoughts Best wishes Heather At PM Lee Friedman wrote This draft has some formatting improvements but it does not yet incorporate some of the comments that we made earlier Heather will make these as soon as possible and before the public releaseeg I sent her specific changes to incorporate Severins restructuring comments Lee Original Message From Heather Cameron mailto Sent Friday October PM To Subject Electricity Summit website Dear Colleagues The new draft website is at eventselectricitysummitconferencehtm Have a good weekend Talk to you on Monday Best wishes Heather

Ready to go publicColleagues The draft website is ready to go public It has been linked to the gspp website It is still the same address eventselectricitysummitconferencehtm Talk to you all soon Best wishes Heather

Your biographical sketchJeff Can you please send me a brief biographical sketch one that will be suitable for posting onthe conference website and also for conference introductions by the Moderator of your panel Professor Howard Shekanski Thanks very much Best wishes Heather Heather Cameron Events Coordinator Richard Rhoda Goldman School of Public Policy University of California Berkeley Hearst Avenue Berkeley CA Tel Fax GSPP home page
Re Your biographical sketchyou Heather At AM you wrote Here it isSee attached file Biography of Jeffrey Dasovichdoc

Re Your funding codeJeff The federal tax payer id is Hope this helps Youre welcome Best wishes Heather At PM you wrote Could you please send me the number you gave me before for purposes of getting the check to you Thanks so much Jeff

Re Draft programAll After listening to the various viewpoints and concerns expressed in our last conference call I believe that the panel options listed in Option of Robs draft might be most effective in producing the type of discourse that we are seeking I propose that we schedule a conference call for this Friday afternoon September at PM EDT I mentioned that I have reserved the Krutch Theater maxcapacity for the week of November I have since been informed that I can only hold the whole week through Wednesday September therefore it will be important to narrow the options down very soon if we can Best wishes Heather At AM wrote Shall we try to talk again Monday I think I will talk to Borenstein to see what the Haas folks have in mind I tried to capture everyones comments Allen you might want to explain more about your panel suggestions since I didnt do them justice As youll see I took the liberty of offering a new characterization of the panels that I didnt bring up on the call Everything on there is offered as a strawman to be criticized and changed Rob Draft programdoc Rob Gramlich PJM Market Monitoring Unit Heather Cameron Events Coordinator The Richard Rhoda Goldman School of Public Policy University of California Berkeley Hearst Avenue Berkeley CA Tel Fax GSPP home page

Re Draft programAll After listening to the various viewpoints and concerns expressed in our last conference call I believe that the panel options listed in Option of Robs draft might be most effective in producing the type of discourse that we are seeking I propose that we schedule a conference call for this Friday afternoon September at PM EDT I mentioned that I have reserved the Krutch Theater maxcapacity for the week of November I have since been informed that I can only hold the whole week through Wednesday September therefore it will be important to narrow the options down very soon if we can Best wishes Heather At AM wrote Shall we try to talk again Monday I think I will talk to Borenstein to see what the Haas folks have in mind I tried to capture everyones comments Allen you might want to explain more about your panel suggestions since I didnt do them justice As youll see I took the liberty of offering a new characterization of the panels that I didnt bring up on the call Everything on there is offered as a strawman to be criticized and changed Rob Draft programdoc Rob Gramlich PJM Market Monitoring Unit Heather Cameron Events Coordinator The Richard Rhoda Goldman School of Public Policy University of California Berkeley Hearst Avenue Berkeley CA Tel Fax GSPP home page
